1.text: A deceitful scale is an abomination with the Lord, and a fair weighing is his will.

2.text: Wherever arrogance may be, there too is insult. But wherever humility is, there too is wisdom.

3.text: The simplicity of the just shall direct them, and the rebellion of the perverse will devastate them.

4.text: Wealth will not profit in the day of vengeance. But justice shall liberate from death.

5.text: The justice of the simple shall direct his way. And the impious will fall in his impiety.

6.text: The justice of the upright shall free them. And the iniquitous will be seized by their own treachery.

7.text: When the impious man is dead, there will no longer be any hope. And the expectation of the anxious will perish.

8.text: The just one is freed from anguish. And the impious one will be handed over instead of him.

9.text: The pretender deceives his friend by mouth. But the just shall be freed by knowledge.

10.text: In the good of the just, the city shall exult. And in the perdition of the impious, there shall be praise.

11.text: By the blessing of the just, the city shall be exalted. And by the mouth of the impious, it will be subverted.

12.text: Whoever despises his friend is destitute in heart. But the prudent man will remain silent.

13.text: Whoever walks dishonestly reveals secrets. But whoever is of a faithful soul conceals what is confided by a friend.

14.text: Where there is no governor, the people shall fall. But where there is much counsel, well-being shall be.

15.text: He will be afflicted with evil, who provides a guarantee for an outsider. But whoever is wary of traps shall be secure.

16.text: A gracious woman shall discover glory. And the robust will have wealth.

17.text: A merciful man benefits his own soul. But whoever is cruel casts out even his close relatives.

18.text: The impious does work with inconstancy. But for the sower of justice, there is the reward of faithfulness.

19.text: Clemency prepares life. And the pursuit of evils prepares death.

20.text: A depraved heart is abominable to the Lord. And his will is with those who walk in simplicity.

21.text: Hand in hand, the evil shall not be innocent. But the offspring of the just shall be saved.

22.text: A beautiful and senseless woman is like a gold ring in the snout of a swine.

23.text: The desire of the just is entirely good. The anticipation of the impious is fury.

24.text: Some distribute their own goods, and they become wealthier. Others seize what is not their own, and they are always in need.

25.text: The soul that blesses shall be made fat. And whoever inebriates will likewise be inebriated himself.

26.text: Whoever hides away grain shall be cursed among the people. But a blessing is upon the head of those who sell it.

27.text: He does well to rise early, who seeks what is good. But whoever is a seeker of evils shall be oppressed by them.

28.text: Whoever trusts in his riches will fall. But the just shall spring up like a green leaf.

29.text: Whoever troubles his own house will possess the winds. And whoever is foolish will serve the wise.

30.text: The fruit of the just one is the tree of life. And whoever receives souls is wise.

31.text: If the just are repaid upon the earth, how much more the impious and the sinner!
